page.title: 29POPULATION
page.content:
The 1986 description of population can still be regarded as largely accurate, although it may be more mixed than it was. For example the report of the 2001 Census for the small area including Charltons has a section giving “approximated social grades” based on the occupations given on the census forms. This shows that one sixth of the population were in AB occupations (higher and intermediate managerial / administrative / professional) and one third in C1 occupations (supervisory, clerical, junior managerial / administrative / professional).
Stephen Larkin
